main.name: Lucas Wu
main.bio: Hi! I'm Lucas, a freshman at the University of Pennsylvania studying Finance and Computer Science in the M&T Program, with an aspiration to submatriculate in Mathematics. I'm interested in Quantitative Finance, particularly trading and software development, as well as topics within Deep Learning.
main.contactmessage: Shoot me an email if you'd like to chat. I'd love to hear from you!

education.degree: B.S. in Economics (Finance/Statistics), B.S.E. in Computer Science
education.description: Wharton Analytics Fellows, Wharton Investment and Trading Group, Wharton Undergraduate Finance Club, Wharton Asia Investments, Penn Club Volleyball Treasurer
Class Body Co-president, Varsity Tennis, International Baccalaureate Bilingual Diploma, Math Club President, Science Club President, Stocks Club President

work.title: Quantitative Analyst Intern
work.description: Researched supply and demand trading, price discovery, and fair value gaps. Currently developing applicable models to trade on supply and demand zone signals.

work.title: Machine Learning Researcher
work.description: Conducted research into efficiency of deep ReLU networks versus shallow exponential-width networks, as well as transformer performance on arithmetic operations.

work.title: Data Science Consultant
work.description: Designed and engineered features for random forest and XGBoost models designed to predict unsubscriptions from email marketing campaigns. Worked on unsupervised learning, classifying customers based on purchase and marketing behaviors.

work.title: First Year Trading and Technology Program (FTTP)
work.description: Selected to participate in a 3-day immersion program at the Jane Street headquarters in New York, competing in manual and automated trading tasks and engaged in desk tours and career panels.

work.title: Qualitative Analyst Intern
work.description: In this role, I produced qualitative research reports on foreign small-cap companies, currency exchanges, alternative investments, and various other investment opportunities. I also worked on javascript-based visualizations for professional display based on time-series data. I proofread market research and investor memos for outreach and exchange purposes.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: At Bond Intelligence, I aided development of live 3D plotly webpage visualizations, utlilizing docker, Django, and python virtual environments to build a local cloud container, and analyzed and created tearsheets on bond and stock data through the quantstats python library in a dash web application. I also worked with databases hosted on SQL Server and on Google Cloud SQL as well as Google Bigquery, in particular completing migration and maintenance.

work.title: Data Analysis Intern
work.description: I worked on a model to detect changes made by web developers to bypass adblockers, utilizing Power BI to process 20 million+ rows of data and derive useful conclusions. From this data, I built visualizations to concisely represent data and served 100,000+ users, providing support to millions of ad blurs per day.
